titleStmt.title: Fragments of Plato's Euthydemus (301 e9 - 302 c6, Ro) and Lysis (208 c2 - d3, Vo)

availability.p: © Digital Corpus of Literary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License .

layout.p: papyrus roll (Ro columns: 2, pagination: 0; Vo columns: 1, pagination: 0)

p.term: Ro: small neat uncial hand, round and upright; Vo: small irregular uncial hand with some admixture of cursive.

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

General - Meta: add biblio 12817, p. 30. Text: Verso, ln. 1: delete [.?]--judging from the note in the ed. pr. it was unintended. Ln. 2: remove extra blank spaces and period after *pap*. Ln. 3: delete period and add *dipunct*. Ln 4: remove extra blank spaces and period after *pap*. Remove period and add *dipunct* after ἔφη. General - Col. 2, ln. 12: add space after apostrophe in δ᾿. Ln. 13: add *dipunct* and delete period. Ln 14: remove extra blank spaces and period after *pap*. Ln 17: remove extra blank spaces and period after *pap*. Change colon to *dipunct* and remove period. Ln. 20: *middot* after ρε. Ln. 23: : remove extra blank spaces and period after *pap*. Ln. 24: add space after τ and remove extra blank spaces and period after *pap*. Ln. 28-29: <:ο̣[ὐκ ἔστι Ζεὺς ὁ πατρῳος;] ---- 29.- ο̣[ὐκ ἔστιν, ἦν δ᾿ ἐγώ]=Johnson, Papyrus Rolls, p. 30|ed|ο̣[ὐκ ἔστι Ζεὺς ὁ πατρῶι] ---- 29.- ο̣[ς]:>.

General - Recto, col. 1. Text, l. 4: change semicolon to *middot*. Line 5: delete period after "pap" and extra blank spaces around pipes and equal signs. L. 6 and 10: add space after apostrophe.

General - Metadata: delete volume number in biblio 95236. Give two biblio entries for 68414, one for each Plato text. Biblio 95691: add pp. 248-256. Treat each keyword separately. TM Author id is 694. TLG Euthydemus. Add 2 columns. Explain in notes that recto preserves Euthydemus and verso Lysis. Change first value of date to 175.

General - Metadata: delete volume number in biblio 95236. Give two biblio entries for 68414, one for each Plato text. Biblio 95691: add pp. 248-256. Treat each keyword separately. TM Author id is 694. TLG Euthydemus. Add 2 columns. Explain in notes that recto preserves Euthydemus and verso Lysis. Change first value of date to 175.

Submit - I have digitised P. Oxy. 6 881 (TM 62631) following Grenfell and Hunt 1908. I integrated the apparatus with Burnet 1903 when additional relevant elements had been pointed out. I did not have the CPF study at my disposal. If you could please check whether the author depicts a paragraphos between ll. 16 and 17 (recto), I would be grateful. I revised the metadata.

Submit - I have digitised P. Oxy. 6 881 (TM 62631) following Grenfell and Hunt 1908. I integrated the apparatus with Burnet 1903 when additional relevant elements had been pointed out. I did not have the CPF study at my disposal. If you could please check whether the author depicts a paragraphos between ll. 16 and 17 (recto), I would be grateful. I revised the metadata.
Crosswalked to EpiDoc XML

div.p: For modern punctuation marks I follow Burnet 1903.

div.ab:

item.p: Between line 16 and line 17 there seems to be a paragraphos not pointed out by Grenfell and Hunt.

div.p: Plato's Euthydemus on the recto and Lysis on the verso
